intro: Scleranthus juvencus, commonly known as the young man's whiskers, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and other open areas. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, often with a rough texture. Scleranthus juvencus is an annual plant that completes its life cycle within a single growing season.
